intro: Cavendishia nitida, commonly known as the velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value lies in its unique leaf texture and delicate floral display.
